DOC.brief_summary: Distal radius fractures are treated surgically if severely displaced. This study aims to investigate the outcome after surgery. The investigators will randomize patients to either external fixation with optional addition of k-wires or open reduction and fixation with a volar plate.
DOC.brief_title: Intraarticular Distal Radius Fractures, X-fix or Volar Fixation
DOC.detailed_description: This study has been merged with NCT 01034943 and a new permit has been issued by the Swedish National board on Ethical Permits
DOC.criteria: Female 5074 years or male 6074 years Dorsally displaced intraarticular distal radius fracture Dorsal angulation >20 degrees measured from the plane perpendicular to the radius axis Low energy trauma Injury <72 hours when diagnosed Patient independent of help for ADL Earlier dysfunction in any wrist Other major injuries Rheumatoid arthritis or other systemic joint disease Dementia or severe psychiatric disease Severe medical condition making general anesthesia a major risk
